results.title: Inspired design and costume sketches
results.brief_description: Costume designers don’t always rely on sketches of their creations. True History of the Kelly Gang designer Alice Babidge sketches to distil references, while Judy & Punch designer Edie Kurzer gets more inspiration from objects.

constellations_primary.name: Inspired design and costume sketches
constellations_primary.description: Costume designers Edie Kurzer and Alice Babidge have worked on some of the most acclaimed Australian and international films and TV, joining the ranks of fellow Australians creatives.

results.description:
Judy & Punch (2019) costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter, in this case Justine Coultham, who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.   

Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.
description_for_label:
Judy & Punch (2019) costume designer Edie Kurzer often explores mood and atmosphere with images instead of using them as direct influences. While she may use sketches to work through details, she gains more inspiration from objects like feathers, buttons or fabrics, and then works with a fabric cutter, in this case Justine Coultham, who sketches how the costume should be cut and assembled.   

Rather than draw what the finished costume should look like, True History of the Kelly Gang (2019) costume designer Alice Babidge uses sketches to distil various reference images into one thought. For Babidge, drawing helps “refine an idea”, while the torn faces on the photos help the actors imagine how they’ll inhabit the character.

results.title: Sandy Powell’s costume designs
results.brief_description: Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script, and then consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Next step is choosing fabrics – one of the most important parts of her process because it inspires the costumes.

constellations_primary.name: Sandy, Swinton, Shakespeare and Derek
constellations_primary.description: Tracing costume designer Sandy Powell's ongoing connections with Tilda Swinton, William Shakespeare and Derek Jarman.

results.description:
Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script. Once she knows the story, she consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Then she fills books – divided into chapters on each character – with research images before she sources fabric. Choosing the kinds of fabric she will use is one of the most important parts of Powell’s process – the fabric gives her the idea for her costumes.    

In The Favourite (2018), Powell uses historically accurate silhouettes but modern materials like second-hand denim, fake leather and vinyl. While you might think costume designers always sketch their designs first, many don’t, including Powell, who dives straight into creating the costumes. She only makes the sketches after she knows what the costumes look like and the actors have tested them.
description_for_label:
Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script. Once she knows the story, she consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Then she fills books – divided into chapters on each character – with research images before she sources fabric. Choosing the kinds of fabric she will use is one of the most important parts of Powell’s process – the fabric gives her the idea for her costumes.    

In The Favourite (2018), Powell uses historically accurate silhouettes but modern materials like second-hand denim, fake leather and vinyl. While you might think costume designers always sketch their designs first, many don’t, including Powell, who dives straight into creating the costumes. She only makes the sketches after she knows what the costumes look like and the actors have tested them.

results.title: Fighting Warrior for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover & manual insert in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Fighting Warrior [computer game] for Commodore 64. Fighting Warrior is a single player side scrolling fighting game. Players have a high, mid and low attack, jump, duck and step back and must fight oncoming enemies in one on one combat.
results.description: Fighting Warrior [computer game] for Commodore 64. Fighting Warrior is a single player side scrolling fighting game. Players have a high, mid and low attack, jump, duck and step back and must fight oncoming enemies in one on one combat.
